trans-unit.source: Provides a way to convert an <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.XPathMessageContext"></xref> to a format that can be serialized as XAML.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.XPathMessageContext> cannot be serialized as XAML.

To solve this problem, use the XPathMessageContextTypeConverter to convert an instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.XPathMessageContext> class to an instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.XamlIntegration.XPathMessageContextMarkupExtension>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.XamlIntegration.XPathMessageContextTypeConverter"></xref> class.
Tests whether a context can be converted from one type to the type of this converter.
A type that provides the format context.
The type to convert from.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the type can be converted; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Tests whether a type can be converted into a target type.
A type that provides the format context.
A type that provides the format context.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the conversion can be performed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Converts the provided context object into the XAML-serializable type of this converter, using the specified context and culture information.
A type that provides the format context.
The information about a specific culture, such as calendars, and number formats.
The object to convert.
The result of the conversion process.
Converts the provided context object into the XAML-serializable type of this converter, using the specified context and culture information.
A type that provides the format context.
The information about a specific culture, such as calendars, and number formats.
The object to convert.
The type to convert the `value` argument to.
The converted context.
